page.title: 11SOUTH MARSTON AIRFIELD (2)
page.content: Marconi, Trans XL, Post Office, Anchor Butter, St.Ivel, Vern air, Eastern Air executive and Wickenby Aviation all use the airstrip. The company{Dollar own a{Bell Jetranger}helicopter which is used for charter flights, aerial photography and pleasure trips. {Swindon Gliding Club}use the airfield in the evening and at weekends. Their gliders are a familiar sight in our evening skies. The airfield has been purchased by {Honda}who are developing the site (see page 7). The{Vickers}jet will move to a nearby RAF station,{Dollar}however will continue to operate from the field.{Honda}intend to use the field as part of a vehicle testing track; they may also use the runway for executive aircraft, but this has not been made clear. It would be a sad day if the airfield fell into disuse.
